definition: to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)

to take a look at/to examine/to survey/(coll.) pretty soon

to regard as having good prospects
to regard as having good prospects
seemingly/apparently/looks as if/appear to be/gives the impression that/seems on the face of it to be
to visit a doctor/to see a patient

sentences.english: I hope he can see the movie next time.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他下回能看这部影片。

sentences.english: no one else can see you shake your head.
Lets go to the cinema together, and Ill call for you.
sentences.chinese: 咱们一起去看电影吧，到时候我来叫你。

sentences.english: Look, Dashan. There's a service station straight ahead.
sentences.chinese: 大山，你看，前边有一家加油站。

sentences.english: Vernet glanced at the key but made no move to touch it.
sentences.chinese: 韦尔内看了一眼那把钥匙，却没有去动它。

sentences.english: And Trump's governing concept shows a strong inclination toward neo-isolationism.
sentences.chinese: 从其执政理念看，新孤立主义倾向明显。

sentences.english: Talent never goes unrecognized, through constant endeavour will it be seen.
sentences.chinese: 世上没有怀才不遇，只看你是否百分百争取。

sentences.english: I finished watching the movie The Proposal this evening.
sentences.chinese: 今天晚上，我看完了电影《假结婚》。

sentences.english: Methods and steps of reading assembly drawings.
sentences.chinese: 看装配图的方法和步骤。

sentences.english: When the article arrived, the editor read the first sentence and then refused to publish it.
sentences.chinese: 稿子寄来后，编辑看第一句话就拒绝予以发表。

sentences.english: She never learned how to read a milometer,or any meter.
sentences.chinese: 不管是里程表，还是什么表，她从来就不会看。

sentences.english: You see, I know how Kirstie feels.
sentences.chinese: 你看，我知道柯斯迪什么感觉。

sentences.english: Look, the moving van is backing into their driveway.
sentences.chinese: 你看，运家具的大卡车正在往他们家的车道上倒车呢。

sentences.english: The sightseer on the tower watches you.
sentences.chinese: 看风景的人在楼上看你。

sentences.english: The sightseer on the tower watches you.
sentences.chinese: 看风景的人在楼上看你。

sentences.english: Sasuke sort of looks like itachi in this picture.
sentences.chinese: 佐助有点像在看这张照片鼬。

to come and see/to see a topic from a certain point of view

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
pleasant to the eye/Taiwan pr. [zhong4 kan4]

that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)

particle indicating that a previously asked question is to be applied to the preceding word ("What about ...?", "And ...?")/particle for inquiring about location ("Where is ...?")/particle signaling a pause, to emphasize the preceding words and allow the listener time to take them on board ("ok?", "are you with me?")/(at the end of a declarative sentence) particle indicating continuation of a state or action/particle indicating strong affirmation
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
